squat.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to sit with your knees bent under you and your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet
squat.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He squatted down beside the little girl.
squat.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to live in a building or on a piece of land without permission and without paying rent
squat.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: short and thick or low and wide, especially in a way which is not attractive
squat.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a house that people are living in without permission and without paying rent
squat.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: She lives in a squat in Camden.
squat.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: nothing, or nearly nothing. Squat is often used in negative sentences for emphasis
squat.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: He had a job that paid him squat.

squat.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: There are people squatting in the house next door.
